pli-tv-kd20:17.3.5: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd20:17.3.6: A nun who is competent and capable should instruct.”
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.1: They instructed without having been appointed.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.2: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.3: “A nun should not instruct if she hasn’t been appointed to do so.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.4: If she does, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.5: I allow a nun to instruct if she has been appointed to do so.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.6: And it should be done like this:
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.7: either one should be appointed through oneself or one should be appointed through another.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.8: And how is one appointed through oneself?
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.9: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.10: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.11: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with Venerable so-and-so.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.12: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, I will instruct so-and-so.’
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.13: In this way one is appointed through oneself.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.14: And how is one appointed through another?
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.15: A competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.16: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.17: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with Venerable so-and-so.
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.18: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, so-and-so will instruct so-and-so.’
pli-tv-kd20:17.4.19: In this way one is appointed through another.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.1: The appointed nun should approach the one seeking the full ordination and say this:
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.3: Now is the time for you to tell the truth.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.4: When asked in the midst of the Sangha about various matters, you should say, “Yes,” if it’s true and, “No,” if it’s not.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.6: This is what they will ask you:
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.7: “Do you lack genitals? Are your genitals incomplete? Are you without menstruation? Do you menstruate continuously? Do you always wear a menstruation pad? Are you incontinent? Do you have genital prolapse? Do you lack sexual organs? Are you manlike? Do you have fistula? Are you a hermaphrodite?
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.8: Do you have any of these diseases:
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.9: leprosy, abscesses, mild leprosy, tuberculosis, or epilepsy?
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.10: Are you human? Are you a woman? Are you a free woman? Are you free from debt? Are you employed by the King?
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.11: Do you have permission from your parents and husband?
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.12: Are you twenty years old? Do you have a full set of bowl and robes? What is your name? What is the name of your mentor?”’”
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.13: They then returned to the Sangha together. The Buddha said,
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.15: The instructor should return first and inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.16: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.17: So-and-so is seeking the full ordination with Venerable so-and-so.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.18: She has been instructed by me.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.19: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, so-and-so should come.’
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.20: And she should be told to come.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.21: She should then put her upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the nuns, squat on her heels, and raise her joined palms. She should then ask for the full ordination:
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.22: ‘Venerables, I ask the Sangha for the full ordination.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.23: May the Sangha lift me up out of compassion.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.24: For the second time, Venerables, I ask the Sangha for the full ordination.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.25: May the Sangha lift me up out of compassion.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.26: For the third time, Venerables, I ask the Sangha for the full ordination.
pli-tv-kd20:17.5.27: May the Sangha lift me up out of compassion.’

pli-tv-kd20:17.8.40: The nuns should be told to point out the three supports and the eight things not to be done to the newly ordained nun.
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.1: On one occasion the right time for eating passed while the nuns were trying to find the right seats in the dining hall.
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.2: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.3: “I allow eight nuns to be seated according to seniority, but the rest according to their time of arrival.”
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.6: eight nuns reserved places everywhere according to seniority, the rest getting places according to their time of arrival.
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.7: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.8: “I allow eight nuns to be seated in the dining hall according to seniority and the rest according to their time of arrival,
pli-tv-kd20:18.1.10: If a nun makes a reservation anywhere apart from the dining hall, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.1: At that time the nuns did not do the invitation procedure.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.2: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.3: “A nun should do the invitation procedure.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.4: If she doesn’t, she should be dealt with according to the rule.”
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.5: At that time the nuns did the invitation procedure among themselves, but not with the Sangha of monks.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.6: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.7: “After doing the invitation procedure among the nuns, a nun should do the invitation procedure with the monks.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.8: If she doesn’t, she should be dealt with according to the rule.”
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.9: All the nuns together did the invitation procedure with monks. They made a racket.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.10: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.11: “The nuns should not do the invitation procedure all together.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.12: Any nun who does commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.13: On one occasion when the nuns did the invitation procedure before the meal, they did not finish until after the time for eating.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.14: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.15: “I allow the nuns to do the invitation procedure after the meal.”
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.16: Doing the invitation procedure after the meal, they did not finish until it was too late to eat.
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.17: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:19.1.18: “I allow the nuns to do the invitation procedure among themselves on one day and with the monks on the following day.”
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.1: At that time the whole Sangha of nuns did the invitation procedure. They made a racket.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.2: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.3: “I allow the nuns to appoint one capable and competent nun
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.4: to do the invitation procedure with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.5: She should be appointed like this.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.6: First a nun should be asked, and then a competent and capable nun should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.7: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.8: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint nun so-and-so to do the invitation procedure with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.10: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.11: The Sangha appoints nun so-and-so to do the invitation procedure with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.12: Any nun who approves of appointing nun so-and-so to do the invitation procedure with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.13: Any nun who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.14: The Sangha has appointed nun so-and-so to do the invitation procedure with the Sangha of monks on behalf of the Sangha of nuns.
pli-tv-kd20:19.2.15: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.1: The appointed nun should take the Sangha of nuns to the Sangha of monks. She should then put her upper robe over one shoulder, squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.2: ʻVenerables, the Sangha of nuns invites the Sangha of monks to correct it concerning
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.3: what you have seen, what you have heard, or what you suspect.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.4: Please correct the Sangha of nuns, Venerables, out of compassion. If the Sangha of nuns sees a fault, it will make amends.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.5: For the second time the Sangha of nuns invites the Sangha of monks to correct it concerning what you have seen, what you have heard, or what you suspect. Please correct the Sangha of nuns, Venerables, out of compassion. If the Sangha of nuns sees a fault, it will make amends.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.6: For the third time the Sangha of nuns invites the Sangha of monks to correct it concerning
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.7: what you have seen, what you have heard, or what you suspect.
pli-tv-kd20:19.3.8: Please correct the Sangha of nuns, Venerables, out of compassion. If the Sangha of nuns sees a fault, it will make amends.’”
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.1: At that time the nuns canceled the monks’ observance-day procedure and their invitation procedure; they spoke to them to initiate a legal process against them; they made accusations against them, asked them for permission to accuse them of offenses, accused them of offenses, and reminded them of offenses.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.2: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.3: “A nun should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a monk.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.4: If she does cancel it, it’s not actually canceled,
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.5: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.6: A nun should not cancel the invitation procedure of a monk.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.7: If she does cancel it, it’s not actually canceled,
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.8: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.9: A nun should not speak to a monk to initiate a legal process against him.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.10: If she does, it’s not actually done,
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.11: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.12: A nun should not make accusations against a monk.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.13: If she does, it’s not actually done,
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.14: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.15: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.16: If she does, it’s not actually done,
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.17: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.18: A nun should not accuse a monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.19: If she does, it’s not actually done,
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.20: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.21: A nun should not remind a monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.22: If she does, it’s not actually done,
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.23: and she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd20:20.1.24: At that time the monks canceled the nuns’ observance-day procedure and their invitation procedure; they spoke to them to initiate a legal process against them; they made accusations against them, asked them for permission to accuse them of offenses, accused them of offenses, and reminded them of offenses.

pli-tv-kd20:20.1.33: If he does, it is properly done,

pli-tv-kd20:21.1.1: At that time the nuns from the group of six traveled in vehicles,
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.2: sometimes pulled by women with men inside, at other times pulled by men with women inside.
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.4: “It’s as if they’re at the Ganges festival.”
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.5: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.6: “A nun should not travel in a vehicle.
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.7: If she does, she should be dealt with according to the rule.”
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.8: Soon afterwards there was a sick nun who was not able to go on foot.
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.9: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.10: “I allow a vehicle for one who is sick.”
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.12: “A vehicle pulled by women or by men?”
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.13: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.14: “I allow a rickshaw pulled either by men or by women.”
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.15: Soon afterwards a certain nun was even more uncomfortable when jolted around in a vehicle.
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.16: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd20:21.1.17: “I allow a palanquin and a litter.”
